data.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine (1961 to 1970) – Part 7
data.meta_description: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine (1961 to 1970) – Part 7 - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
2. Year: 1961 Georg von Békésy Born: 3 June 1899 Died: 13 June1972 Country: United States Field: Biophysics Nobel Prize For his discoveries of the physical mechanism of stimulation within the cochlea. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine

3. Year: 1962 Francis Harry Compton Crick Born: 8 June 1916 Died: 28 July 2004 Country: United Kingdom Field: Physics, Molecular Biology Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nucleic acids and its significance for information transfer in living material. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

4. Year: 1962 James Dewey Watson Born: 6 April 1928 Age: 89 Years Country: United States Field: Genetics Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nucleic acids and its significance for information transfer in living material. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

5. Year: 1962 Maurice Wilkins Born: 15 December 1916 Died: 5 October 2004 Country: New Zealand, United Kingdom Field: Physics, Molecular Biology Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nucleic acids and its significance for information transfer in living material. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine

6. Year: 1963 Sir John Eccles Born: 27 January 1903 Died : 2 May 1997 Country: Australia Field: Neuroscience, Philosophy of Mind Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the ionic mechanisms involved in excitation and inhibition in the peripheral and central portions of the nerve cell membrane. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

7. Year: 1963 Sir Alan Lloyd Hodgkin Born: 5 February 1914 Died : 20 December 1998 Country: United Kingdom Field: Physiology and Biophysics Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the ionic mechanisms involved in excitation and inhibition in the peripheral and central portions of the nerve cell membrane. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

8. Year: 1963 Sir Andrew Huxley Born: 22 November 1917 Died : 30 May 2012 Country: United Kingdom Field: Physiology and biophysics Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the ionic mechanisms involved in excitation and inhibition in the peripheral and central portions of the nerve cell membrane. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine

9. Year: 1964 Konrad Bloch Born: 21 January 1912 Died : 15 October 2000 Country: United States Field: Biochemistry, Metabolism, Physiology Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the mechanism and regulation of the cholesterol and fatty acid metabolism. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

10. Year: 1964 Feodor Lynen Born: 6 April 1911 Died : 6 August 1979 Country: West Germany Field: Biochemistry, Metabolism, Physiology Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning the mechanism and regulation of the cholesterol and fatty acid metabolism. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine

12. Year: 1965 André Michel Lwoff Born: 8 May 1902 Died: 30 September 1994 Country: France Field: Microbiology Nobel Prize For their discoveries concerning genetic control of enzyme and virus synthesis. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

14. Year: 1966 Francis Peyton Rous Born: 5 October 1879 Died: 16 February 1970 Country: United States Field: Virology Nobel Prize For his discovery of tumour-inducing viruses. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine continued…

15. Year: 1966 Charles Brenton Huggins Born: 22 September 1901 Died: 12 January 1997 Country: United States Field: Physiology Nobel Prize For his discoveries concerning hormonal treatment of prostatic cancer. (Image Source: Wikipedia) Nobel Prize Winners in Physiology or Medicine
